name: Treasure Flower
climate: Treasure Flowers thrive in warm climates, preferring temperatures above 60Â°F.
These flowers are native to South Africa, enjoying dry and sunny environments.
They can tolerate mild frost but grow best in regions with hot, dry summers.
Treasure Flowers can adapt to coastal climates, tolerating salty winds.
sunlight: Treasure Flowers require full sun exposure to bloom profusely.
They need at least 6 hours of direct sunlight to thrive and flower.
In shaded areas, their growth might be stunted and flowering reduced.
Sunlight encourages vibrant colors and healthy growth in Treasure Flowers.
watering: Treasure Flowers are drought-tolerant and prefer infrequent watering.
Allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings to prevent root rot.
Overwatering can lead to yellowing leaves and root disease in these plants.
In hot summers, water once a week but ensure soil drainage is excellent.
soil: Treasure Flowers require well-draining soil to prevent waterlogging.
Sandy or gritty soils with low organic matter are ideal for these flowers.
Soil pH should be neutral to slightly alkaline for optimal growth.
Compacted or clay soils should be avoided to prevent root suffocation.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent flowers regularly to encourage continuous blooming.
Mulching can help retain soil moisture and reduce weed competition.
In cooler regions, grow Treasure Flowers in pots to overwinter indoors.
Fertilize sparingly, as too much can encourage leafy growth over flowers.
